verses.verse: And it came to pass, when Saul<WH7586> was returned<WH7725> from following<WH310> the Philistines<WH6430>, that it was told<WH5046> him, saying<WH559>, Behold, David<WH1732> is in the wilderness<WH4057> of Engedi<WH5872>. following: Heb. after

And he came<WH935> to the sheepcotes<WH1448> <WH6629> by the way<WH1870>, where was a cave<WH4631>; and Saul<WH7586> went in<WH935> to cover<WH5526> his feet<WH7272>: and David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> remained<WH3427> in the sides<WH3411> of the cave<WH4631>.

Then David<WH1732> arose<WH6965>, and cut off<WH3772> the skirt<WH3671> of Saul's<WH7586> robe<WH4598> privily<WH3909>. Saul's: Heb. the robe which was Saul's
And it came to pass afterward<WH310>, that David's<WH1732> heart<WH3820> smote<WH5221> him, because he had cut off<WH3772> Saul's<WH7586> skirt<WH3671>.

And he said<WH559> unto his men<WH582>, The LORD<WH3068> forbid<WH2486> that I should do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697> unto my master<WH113>, the LORD'S<WH3068> anointed<WH4899>, to stretch forth<WH7971> mine hand<WH3027> against him, seeing he is the anointed<WH4899> of the LORD<WH3068>.

So David<WH1732> stayed<WH8156> his servants<WH582> with these words<WH1697>, and suffered<WH5414> them not to rise<WH6965> against Saul<WH7586>. But Saul<WH7586> rose up<WH6965> out of the cave<WH4631>, and went<WH3212> on his way<WH1870>. stayed: Heb. cut off

David<WH1732> also arose<WH6965> afterward, and went out<WH3318> of the cave<WH4631>, and cried<WH7121> after<WH310> Saul<WH7586>, saying<WH559>, My lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>. And when Saul<WH7586> looked<WH5027> behind<WH310> him, David<WH1732> stooped<WH6915> with his face<WH639> to the earth<WH776>, and bowed<WH7812> himself.
And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul<WH7586>, Wherefore hearest<WH8085> thou men's<WH120> words<WH1697>, saying<WH559>, Behold, David<WH1732> seeketh<WH1245> thy hurt<WH7451>?

Behold, this day<WH3117> thine eyes<WH5869> have seen<WH7200> how that the LORD<WH3068> had delivered<WH5414> thee to day<WH3117> into mine hand<WH3027> in the cave<WH4631>: and some bade<WH559> me kill<WH2026> thee: but mine eye spared<WH2347> thee; and I said<WH559>, I will not put forth<WH7971> mine hand<WH3027> against my lord<WH113>; for he is the LORD'S<WH3068> anointed<WH4899>.

Moreover, my father<WH1>, see<WH7200>, yea, see<WH7200> the skirt<WH3671> of thy robe<WH4598> in my hand<WH3027>: for in that I cut off<WH3772> the skirt<WH3671> of thy robe<WH4598>, and killed<WH2026> thee not, know<WH3045> thou and see<WH7200> that there is neither evil<WH7451> nor transgression<WH6588> in mine hand<WH3027>, and I have not sinned<WH2398> against thee; yet thou huntest<WH6658> my soul<WH5315> to take<WH3947> it.
The LORD<WH3068> judge<WH8199> between me and thee, and the LORD<WH3068> avenge<WH5358> me of thee: but mine hand<WH3027> shall not be upon thee.
As saith<WH559> the proverb<WH4912> of the ancients<WH6931>, Wickedness<WH7562> proceedeth<WH3318> from the wicked<WH7563>: but mine hand<WH3027> shall not be upon thee.
After<WH310> whom is the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> come out<WH3318>? after<WH310> whom dost thou pursue<WH7291>? after<WH310> a dead<WH4191> dog<WH3611>, after<WH310> a<WH259> flea<WH6550>.

The LORD<WH3068> therefore be judge<WH1781>, and judge<WH8199> between me and thee, and see<WH7200>, and plead<WH7378> my cause<WH7379>, and deliver<WH8199> me out of thine hand<WH3027>. deliver: Heb. judge

And it came to pass, when David<WH1732> had made an end<WH3615> of speaking<WH1696> these words<WH1697> unto Saul<WH7586>, that Saul<WH7586> said<WH559>, Is this thy voice<WH6963>, my son<WH1121> David<WH1732>? And Saul<WH7586> lifted up<WH5375> his voice<WH6963>, and wept<WH1058>.
And he said<WH559> to David<WH1732>, Thou art more righteous<WH6662> than I: for thou hast rewarded<WH1580> me good<WH2896>, whereas I have rewarded<WH1580> thee evil<WH7451>.

And thou hast shewed<WH5046> this day<WH3117> how that thou hast dealt<WH6213> well<WH2896> with me: forasmuch as when the LORD<WH3068> had delivered<WH5462> me into thine hand<WH3027>, thou killedst<WH2026> me not. delivered: Heb. shut up

For if a man<WH376> find<WH4672> his enemy<WH341>, will he let him go<WH7971> well<WH2896> away<WH1870>? wherefore the LORD<WH3068> reward<WH7999> thee good<WH2896> for that thou hast done<WH6213> unto me this day<WH3117>.
And now, behold, I know well<WH3045> that thou shalt surely<WH4427> be king<WH4427>, and that the kingdom<WH4467> of Israel<WH3478> shall be established<WH6965> in thine hand<WH3027>.

Swear<WH7650> now therefore unto me by the LORD<WH3068>, that thou wilt not<WH518> cut off<WH3772> my seed<WH2233> after<WH310> me, and that thou wilt not destroy<WH8045> my name<WH8034> out of my father's<WH1> house<WH1004>.
And David<WH1732> sware<WH7650> unto Saul<WH7586>. And Saul<WH7586> went<WH3212> home<WH1004>; but David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> gat them up<WH5927> unto the hold<WH4686>.
